column4: cdbuya is it normal that iwconfig does NOT see the wireless in the environment even if wlassistant does?
I don't know about your specific WLAN card, but mine only works "halfway" even with DriverLoader.... if I do the setup manually it doesn't work at all...
wireless card functions perfectly, I have already connected more than once from Linux
just that your iwconfig doesn't see the card, even when it's connected?
uhm damn I dunno right know...I mean I am under Windows obviously so I cannot check
obviously?  heh... I switched over to Linux just to use xchat. =)
I have dual boot, but it does NOT connect from Linux, so I cannot use it right now :-P

I have a similar problem with my Wireless... It is properly configured in both Windows XP and Ubuntu, with identical WEP keys (Using WEP because I have another computer that is "B" only/WEP only) and only my Windows install will connect to the router.
EXACTLY my problem
surely I do NOT understand why
what did you use to configure the WLAN and can you activate it?
wlassistant
the wireless did functin from the first moment I installed ubuntu
so did mine, rather, it was detected and present since I put in the LiveCD, but I couldn't actually activate it until I used Driverloader instead of NDISWrapper.
no similar problem, it worked always smoothly...but in these cases
have you seen my PM?
I have not... one moment
my fault I am not a registered user
Perhaps you should register... it is Free. =)
/join #broadcom
disconnected for a moment
I saw that. =)
